channel.title: Comments on: Fun project in Silverlight
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: That is pretty cool Rick and it also works in Google Chrome on Windows 7 :-)
item.content:encoded: That is pretty cool Rick and it also works in Google Chrome on Windows 7 ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: ThatRickGuy
item.dc:creator: ThatRickGuy
item.content:encoded:
I’ve got a few more SL based blog entries to write. I have 2 Silverlight 3 applications currently running in production environments, and a 3rd major system in development now and another SL/SharePoint system in early discussion.

So far I have to say, Silverlight it a huge step up for developing in over the ASP.Net/AJAX/Javascript/JQuery/CSS stack. The only downside is the platform limitations.

-Rick

item.title: By: Alex Ullrich
item.dc:creator: Alex Ullrich
item.description: That was quick! You should write more about your experiences w/ Silverlight. I dabble now and then but never for anything serious. But I think in a few months me and Silverlight might be ready to take that next step in our relationship, it'd be good to be prepared.
item.content:encoded: That was quick! You should write more about your experiences w/ Silverlight. I dabble now and then but never for anything serious. But I think in a few months me and Silverlight might be ready to take that next step in our relationship, it’d be good to be prepared.
